newsitem.title: PERU: Peru 28-day CDs draw 15.74 pct avg rate at sale.
newsitem.headline: Peru 28-day CDs draw 15.74 pct avg rate at sale.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru said Thursday it accepted bids for 28-day Certificates of Deposit (CDs) worth 20.0 million soles at an effective average annual rate of 15.74 percent at auction BCQZ.
The CDs have a November 29 starting date.
The accepted bids also had a minimum rate of 15.50 percent and a maximum rate of 16.00 percent, the bank said.
At the last CD auction on November 13, 28-day CDs drew an average rate of 14.74 percent.
At Thursday's auction, the bank said it received bids on the CDs totalling 41.3 million soles.
The bank had offered 20 million soles worth of CDs.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates is used as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
